required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hepatic Arterial Infusion Combined With Lenvatinib and Camrelizumab for Unresectable Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Hepatic Arterial Infusion Chemotherapy Plus Lenvatinib and Camrelizumab for Unresectable Hepatocellular Carcinoma：a Prospective, Single-arm，Phase II Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of hepatic arterial infusion chemotherapy of oxaliplatin and raltitrexed plus lenvatinib and camrelizumab in patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

detailed_description.textblock: Hepatic arterial infusion chemotherapy (HAIC) of oxaliplatin and raltitrexed was effective and safe for hepatocellular carcinoma. Lenvatinib was non-inferior to sorafenib in overall survival in untreated advanced hepatocellular carcinoma, and programmed cell death protein-1 (PD-1) antibody was effective and tolerable in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma. No study has evaluated HAIC of oxaliplatin and raltitrexed plus lenvatinib and camrelizumab. Thus, the investigators carried out this prospective, single-arm study to find out it.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, development of unacceptable toxicity, withdrawal of consent, or sponsor termination (up to approximately 3 years)
primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of participants who have best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) at the time of data cutoff as assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, stable disease, development of unacceptable toxicity, withdrawal of consent, or sponsor termination (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: DCR is defined as the percentage of participants who have best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) at the time of data cutoff as assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first documentation of CR or PR to the first date of documentation of disease progression or death whichever occurs first (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from the first documentation of CR or PR to the date of first documentation of disease progression or death (whichever occurs first) as assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival rate at 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug to the date of first documentation of disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The progression free survival time defined as the time from the first study dose date to the date of first documentation of disease progression as assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug to the date of first documentation of death from any cause, whichever occurs first (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: OS is measured from the start date of the Treatment Phase (date of first study dose) until date of death from any cause. Participants who are lost to follow-up and the participants who are alive at the date of data cutoff will be censored at the date the participant was last known alive or the cut-off date, whichever comes earlier.

secondary_outcome.measure: The median progression free survival time (mPFS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug to the date of first documentation of disease progression (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The progression free survival time (mPFS) defined as the time from the first study dose date to the date of first documentation of disease progression as assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start date of the Treatment Phase until date of death from any cause (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: OS is measured from the start date of the Treatment Phase (date of first study dose) until date of death from any cause. Participants who are lost to follow-up and the participants who are alive at the date of data cutoff will be censored at the date the participant was last known alive or the cut-off date, whichever comes earlier.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start date of the Treatment Phase until date of death from any cause (up to approximately 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be evaluated according to the NCI CTCAE Version 5.0. All observations pertinent to the safety of the study medication will be recorded on the CRF and included in the final report.

arm_group.description: Hepatic arterial infusion of oxaliplatin and raltitrexed every 3 weeks. Lenvatinib 8 mg once daily (QD) oral dosing. Camrelizumab 200mg intravenously every 3 weeks.

intervention.description: administration of oxaliplatin and raltitrexed via the tumor feeding arteries every 3 weeks.

overall_official.affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

facility.name: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
